text_raw:
2. The Oireachtas (Allowances) (Members and Holders of Parliamentary 
and Certain Ministerial Offices) Order 2020 (S.I. No. 613 of 2020) is 
amended – 

(a) 

by the substitution of the following Article for Article 5: 

“5. There is payable to – 

(a) Hildegarde Naughton, Minister of State at – 

(i) 

the Department of the Taoiseach, and 

(ii) 

the Department of Health, 

(b) 

Jack Chambers, Minister of State at – 

(i) 

the Department of Transport, and 

the Department of 
Climate and Communications, 

the Environment, 

(ii) 

and 

(c) Pippa Hackett, Minister of State at 

the 
Department of Agriculture, Food and the Marine, 

for any period beginning on or after 17 December 2022, as the 
holders of those offices, respectively, who regularly attend 
meetings of the Government, an annual allowance at the rate of 
€12,173.”, 

(b) by the substitution of the following Article for Article 6: 

“6. (1) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who 
holds or held the position of chairperson of an Oireachtas

"Iris Oifigiúil" of 9th May, 2023.

(2) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who 
holds or held the position of chairperson of the Oireachtas 
Committee known as the Committee on Members’ Interests of

as holder of that position, annually –

at the rate of €3,356 in respect of any period

(3) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who 
holds or held the position of chairperson of the Oireachtas 
Committee known as the Joint Committee on Autism an 
allowance, in respect of the member’s duties as holder of that 
position, annually – 

(a) 

(b) 

at the rate of €9,982 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 2 February 2022, 

at the rate of €10,082 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 1 October 2022, and

(4) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who held

(a)

beginning on or after 1 October 2021, 

at the rate of €9,691 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 1 February 2022, 

at the rate of €9,982 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 2 February 2022, and 

at the rate of €10,082 in respect of any period 
beginning on or after 1 October 2022, 

during which the member held that position. 

(5) There is payable to a member of the Oireachtas who held 
the position of chairperson of the Oireachtas Committee known 
as the Joint Committee on International Surrogacy an allowance, 
in respect of the member’s duties as holder of that position, 
annually at the rate of €9,982 in respect of any period beginning 
on or after 2 February 2022, during which the member held that 
position.”,
